‘ Wind River ’ was directed by Taylor Sheridan known for directing Sicario and stars Jeremy Renner as a hunter who finds a dead frozen body that appears to be badly raped on the Wind River Indian Reservation in winter With the help from an FBI agent played by Elizabeth Olsen ), the duo and some other officers investigate the c ase which can be a homicide trying to find a murder so as to prevent the c ase from expanding However. Although this movie had already come out here but I couldn ’ t really get around to review ing it until now In my opinion this movie is a bit overrated but it doesn’t mean the movie was bad Though I had a anticipation for this movie cos of some other people ’ s reviews most of which were quite good this movie was not what I expected actually Like the story was very quiet so serious that it has no jokes or anything that made me laugh even a bit and no twists I assumed that those people investigating the c ase would sort it out by keeping on discovering stuff related to that issue and the c ase would gradually be solved but as I said since th er e’s no twist or anything unexpected the movie just goes on as we see I can ’ t say anything related to its punchline otherwise my review should be a spoiler However this movie was just a typical crime film taking place only in a very snowy location So felt a bit relieved that it was less than two hours long cos I ’ d have defiantly got bored or perhaps fallen asleep if it had been much longer Apart from the story I really enjoyed seeing its cinematography that was quite marvellous as The Snowman one of the terrible crime films tho and their performances were really great as well especially Jeremy Renner He doesn’t really talk that much in this film but it was really cool to see him speaking very quietly with his serious expression on his face particularly at the end of the film. Anyway it was not as good as people say for me but could get some point of what the director actually wanted to tell us through this movie and I also think it ’ s very important for all of us to pay more attention to those issues which are reported in this movie. Thank you for reading my brief review of ‘ Wind River ’!.
